intro: Urera simplex, commonly known as the white soursop or white guanabana, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, spiny fruit that contains a single large seed. Its botanical features include smooth, waxy leaves and a climbing or shrub-like growth habit. Urera simplex is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
